title: Funen (Folketing constituency)
text:
Funen () is one of the 12 <a href="multi-member">multi-member</a> <a href="Constituencies%20of%20Denmark">constituencies</a> of the <a href="Folketing">Folketing</a>, the national <a href="legislature">legislature</a> of <a href="Denmark">Denmark</a>. The constituency was established in 2007 following the public administration structural reform. It consists of the <a href="Municipalities%20of%20Denmark">municipalities</a> of <a href="%C3%86r%C3%B8%20Municipality">Ærø</a>, <a href="Assens%20Municipality">Assens</a>, <a href="Faaborg-Midtfyn%20Municipality">Faaborg-Midtfyn</a>, <a href="Kerteminde%20Municipality">Kerteminde</a>, <a href="Langeland%20Municipality">Langeland</a>, <a href="Middelfart%20Municipality">Middelfart</a>, <a href="Nordfyn%20Municipality">Nordfyn</a>, <a href="Nyborg%20Municipality">Nyborg</a>, <a href="Odense%20Municipality">Odense</a> and <a href="Svendborg%20Municipality">Svendborg</a>. The constituency currently elects 12 of the 179 members of the Folketing using the <a href="Open%20list">open</a> <a href="party-list%20proportional%20representation">party-list proportional representation</a> <a href="electoral%20system">electoral system</a>. At the <a href="2019%20Danish%20general%20election">2019 general election</a> it had 374,322 registered electors.
Electoral system.
Funen currently elects 12 of the 179 members of the Folketing using the <a href="Open%20list">open</a> <a href="party-list%20proportional%20representation">party-list proportional representation</a> <a href="electoral%20system">electoral system</a>. Constituency seats are allocated using the <a href="D%27Hondt%20method">D'Hondt method</a>. <a href="Compensatory%20seat">Compensatory seat</a>s are calculated based on the national vote and are allocated using the <a href="Sainte-Lagu%C3%AB%20method">Sainte-Laguë method</a>, initially at the <a href="Provinces%20of%20Denmark">provincial</a> level and finally at the constituency level. Only parties that reach any one of three thresholds stipulated by section 77 of the Folketing (Parliamentary) Elections Act - winning at least one constituency seat; obtaining at least the <a href="Hare%20quota">Hare quota</a> (valid votes in province/number of constituency seats in province) in two of the three provinces; or obtaining at least 2% of the national vote - compete for compensatory seats.
Election results.
Detailed.
2019.
Results of the <a href="2019%20Danish%20general%20election">2019 general election</a> held on 5 June 2019:
Votes per municipality:
The following candidates were elected:
<a href="Alex%20Ahrendtsen">Alex Ahrendtsen</a> (O), 2,656 votes; <a href="Marlene%20Ambo-Rasmussen">Marlene Ambo-Rasmussen</a> (V), 12,301 votes; <a href="Erling%20Bonnesen">Erling Bonnesen</a> (V), 15,513 votes; <a href="Trine%20Bramsen">Trine Bramsen</a> (A), 19,903 votes; <a href="Bj%C3%B8rn%20Brandenborg">Bjørn Brandenborg</a> (A), 11,144 votes; <a href="Jens%20Henrik%20Thulesen%20Dahl">Jens Henrik Thulesen Dahl</a> (O), 2,913 votes; <a href="Jane%20Heitmann">Jane Heitmann</a> (V), 8,004 votes; <a href="Karsten%20H%C3%B8nge">Karsten Hønge</a> (F), 4,146 vots; <a href="Jan%20Johansen%20%28politician%29">Jan Johansen</a> (A), 12,012 votes; <a href="Dan%20J%C3%B8rgensen">Dan Jørgensen</a> (A), 28,885 votes; <a href="Lars%20Christian%20Lilleholt">Lars Christian Lilleholt</a> (V), 19,394 votes; <a href="Mai%20Mercado">Mai Mercado</a> (C), 13,494 votes; <a href="Rasmus%20Helveg%20Petersen">Rasmus Helveg Petersen</a> (B), 3,763 votes; <a href="Julie%20Skovsby">Julie Skovsby</a> (A), 7,512 votes; and <a href="Victoria%20Velasquez">Victoria Velasquez</a> (Ø), 7,233 votes.
2015.
Results of the <a href="2015%20Danish%20general%20election">2015 general election</a> held on 18 June 2015:
Votes per municipality:
The following candidates were elected:
<a href="Alex%20Ahrendtsen">Alex Ahrendtsen</a> (O), 13,702 votes; <a href="Pernille%20Bendixen">Pernille Bendixen</a> (O), 9,524 votes; <a href="Erling%20Bonnesen">Erling Bonnesen</a> (V), 15,857 votes; <a href="Trine%20Bramsen">Trine Bramsen</a> (A), 16,666 votes; <a href="Erik%20Christensen%20%28politician%29">Erik Christensen</a> (A), 8,024 votes; <a href="Jens%20Henrik%20Thulesen%20Dahl">Jens Henrik Thulesen Dahl</a> (O), 26,753 votes; <a href="Jane%20Heitmann">Jane Heitmann</a> (V), 8,307 votes; <a href="Karsten%20H%C3%B8nge">Karsten Hønge</a> (F), 5,015 vots; <a href="Jan%20Johansen%20%28politician%29">Jan Johansen</a> (A), 18,894 votes; <a href="Dan%20J%C3%B8rgensen">Dan Jørgensen</a> (A), 29,333 votes; <a href="Lars%20Christian%20Lilleholt">Lars Christian Lilleholt</a> (V), 15,705 votes; <a href="Rune%20Lund">Rune Lund</a> (Ø), 1,758 votes; <a href="Roger%20Matthisen">Roger Matthisen</a>(Å), 5,109 votes; <a href="Mai%20Mercado">Mai Mercado</a> (C), 8,275 votes; <a href="Merete%20Riisager">Merete Riisager</a> (I), 16,481 votes; <a href="Pernille%20Skipper">Pernille Skipper</a> (Ø), 13,895 votes; <a href="Julie%20Skovsby">Julie Skovsby</a> (A), 7,598 votes; and <a href="Dorthe%20Ullemose">Dorthe Ullemose</a> (O), 7,148 votes.
2011.
Results of the <a href="2011%20Danish%20general%20election">2011 general election</a> held on 15 September 2011:
Votes per municipality:
The following candidates were elected:
<a href="Alex%20Ahrendtsen">Alex Ahrendtsen</a> (O), 6,983 votes; <a href="Anne%20Baastrup">Anne Baastrup</a> (F), 12,569 votes; <a href="Erling%20Bonnesen">Erling Bonnesen</a> (V), 16,239 votes; <a href="Trine%20Bramsen">Trine Bramsen</a> (A), 8,464 votes; <a href="Jens%20Henrik%20Thulesen%20Dahl">Jens Henrik Thulesen Dahl</a> (O), 14,961 votes; <a href="Jakob%20Ellemann-Jensen">Jakob Ellemann-Jensen</a> (V), 17,095 votes; <a href="Carsten%20Hansen%20%28politician%29">Carsten Hansen</a> (A), 15,470 votes; <a href="Jane%20Heitmann">Jane Heitmann</a> (V), 8,535 votes; <a href="Mai%20Henriksen">Mai Henriksen</a> (C), 7,213 votes; <a href="Camilla%20Hersom">Camilla Hersom</a> (B), 14,769 votes; <a href="Jan%20Johansen%20%28politician%29">Jan Johansen</a> (A), 7,982 votes; <a href="Lars%20Christian%20Lilleholt">Lars Christian Lilleholt</a> (V), 23,111 votes; <a href="Merete%20Riisager">Merete Riisager</a> (I), 8,141 votes; <a href="Pernille%20Rosenkrantz-Theil">Pernille Rosenkrantz-Theil</a> (A), 32,337 votes; <a href="Pernille%20Skipper">Pernille Skipper</a> (Ø), 5,777 votes; <a href="Julie%20Skovsby">Julie Skovsby</a> (A), 7,489 votes; and <a href="Annette%20Vilhelmsen">Annette Vilhelmsen</a> (F), 5,782 votes.
2007.
Results of the <a href="2007%20Danish%20general%20election">2007 general election</a> held on 13 November 2007:
Votes per municipality:
The following candidates were elected:
<a href="Poul%20Andersen%20%28politician%29">Poul Andersen</a> (A), 10,234 votes; <a href="Anne%20Baastrup">Anne Baastrup</a> (F), 23,011 votes; <a href="Bendt%20Bendtsen">Bendt Bendtsen</a> (C), 33,026 votes; <a href="Erling%20Bonnesen">Erling Bonnesen</a> (V), 21,028 votes; <a href="Jens%20Henrik%20Thulesen%20Dahl">Jens Henrik Thulesen Dahl</a> (O), 35,865 votes; <a href="Carsten%20Hansen%20%28politician%29">Carsten Hansen</a> (A), 19,152 votes; <a href="Britta%20Schall%20Holberg">Britta Schall Holberg</a> (V), 7,458 votes; <a href="Karsten%20H%C3%B8nge">Karsten Hønge</a> (F), 5,996 votes; <a href="Vivi%20Kier">Vivi Kier</a> (C), 3,022 votes; <a href="Lars%20Christian%20Lilleholt">Lars Christian Lilleholt</a> (V), 17,525 votes; <a href="Niels%20Helveg%20Petersen">Niels Helveg Petersen</a> (B), 8,211 votes; <a href="Tina%20Petersen">Tina Petersen</a> (O), 3,568 votes; <a href="Niels%20Sindal">Niels Sindal</a> (A), 12,061 votes; <a href="Julie%20Skovsby">Julie Skovsby</a> (A), 15,520 votes;
